text.name: AD_parkVehicle_noPosSet
text.text: Geen parkeerbestemming toegewezen. Wijzig het momenteel geselecteerde bestemming toe met de rechtermuisknop.

text.name: gui_ad_followDistance_tooltip
text.text: Distance kept from combine when following it's rear end

text.name: gui_ad_lookahead_turning_tooltip
text.text: De afstand die het voertuig vooruit kijkt om de besturing aan te passen om het volgende segment te volgen

text.name: gui_ad_useFastestRoute_tooltip
text.text: Bij het berekenen wordt rekening gehouden met de verwachte rijsnelheid, niet alleen met de afstand

text.name: gui_ad_mapMarkerDetour_tooltip
text.text: Maximale Omweg als Bestemmingen moeten worden vermeden

text.name: gui_ad_siloEmpty_tooltip
text.text: Hoe een Chauffeur voor Ophalen en Afleveren reageert op een lege Silo

text.name: gui_ad_useFolders_tooltip
text.text: Gebruik mappen om bestemmingen te structureren

text.name: gui_ad_autoConnect_start_tooltip
text.text: Automatisch Verbinden met het dichtstbijzijnde RoutePunt bij het starten van de Opname

text.name: gui_ad_autoConnect_end_tooltip
text.text: Automatisch Verbinden met het dichtstbijzijnde RoutePunt bij het stoppen van de Opname

text.name: gui_ad_parkInField_tooltip
text.text: Na het lossen van de Combine - als het niet in het Fruit geparkeerd is

text.name: gui_ad_unloadFillLevel_tooltip
text.text: Na het lossen van de Combine. Direct Afleveren na het bereiken van dit Vulniveau.

text.name: gui_ad_gui_scale_tooltip
text.text: Laat op standaard staan (default) om de in-game schaalinstelling te gebruiken

text.name: gui_ad_exitField_tooltip
text.text: Veld Exit strategie na het lossen. Start(standaard) / Achter StartPunt / Dichtstbijzijnde Punt

text.name: gui_ad_driverWages_tooltip
text.text: Het loon van de bestuurder wordt vermenigvuldigd met deze waarde

text.name: gui_ad_showNextPath_tooltip
text.text: Schakel de weergave van de volgende twee RoutePunten In/Uit

text.name: gui_ad_avoidFruit_tooltip
text.text: De losser van de Combine probeert Fruitvernietiging te voorkomen

text.name: gui_ad_pathFinderTime
text.text: Tijd om een route te zoeken (max)

text.name: gui_ad_pathFinderTime_tooltip
text.text: Bepaalt hoe lang een rijder naar een botsingsvrije route kan zoeken. Hoge waarden kunnen het spel vertragen

text.name: gui_ad_lineHeight_tooltip
text.text: Lijnhoogte in Editor-modus. Op grondniveau of boven de tractor

text.name: gui_ad_enableTrafficDetection_tooltip
text.text: Geavanceerde botsingsdetectie, die ook AI-verkeer, borden, hekken enz. detecteert

text.name: gui_ad_shovelWidth_tooltip
text.text: Als de automatisch gedetecteerde shovel te klein is, kan dat met deze waarde worden verhoogd

text.name: gui_ad_preCallLevel_tooltip
text.text: Bestuurder eerder oproepen op het ingestelde vulniveau.

text.name: gui_ad_distributeToFolder_tooltip
text.text: Alle bestemmingen in dezelfde folder worden geroteerd als los bestemming.

text.name: gui_ad_maxTriggerDistance_tooltip
text.text: Afstand tot los/laad bestemming waar de trigger wordt gevonden en geactiveerd.

text.name: gui_ad_restrictToField_tooltip
text.text: Als de chauffeur is geparkeerd in het veld, dan wordt de route binnen het veld gezocht.

text.name: gui_ad_showTooltips_tooltip
text.text: Laat tooltips van de knoppen in de HUD zien.

text.name: gui_ad_autoRefuel_tooltip
text.text: Naar tank bestemming rijden (dichtbij tank trigger) als de tank bijna leeg is.

text.name: gui_ad_shovelHeight_tooltip
text.text: Als de automatisch gedetecteerde schophoogte niet correct is. Gebruik dit om de doelhoogte van de grond aan te passen

text.name: gui_ad_cornerSpeed_tooltip
text.text: Pas de hoeksnelheid aan voor een individueel voertuig. Massa en huidige snelheid zullen nog steeds het rempunt beÃ¯nvloeden

text.name: gui_ad_callSecondUnloader_tooltip
text.text: Bel 2. Ontlader wanneer de huidige ontlader het voorloopvullingsniveau bereikt

text.name: gui_ad_followOnlyOnField_tooltip
text.text: Restrict unloader to field while actively unloading

text.name: gui_ad_addSettingsToHUD_tooltip
text.text: Adds buttons to the HUD to change settings without opening this menu

text.name: gui_ad_iconSetToUse_tooltip
text.text: Default logo or personalized logo - Selection can be expanded.

text.name: gui_ad_secondEditorModeAllowed_tooltip
text.text: Use 2. editor mode for route manipulation instead of holding down LCTRL

text.name: gui_ad_wideHUD_tooltip
text.text: Use wide HUD mode, which also allows a few more setting buttons in the HUD

text.name: gui_ad_syncMultiTargets_tooltip
text.text: Multiple drivers using the same folder for multiple targets will synchronize next targets

text.name: gui_ad_settingsClosingDialog_text
text.text: Weet u zeker dat u de instellingen wilt sluiten zonder op te slaan?

text.name: gui_ad_routesManagerTextTitle
text.text: Voeg de naam van de route in:

text.name: gui_ad_routeExportWarn_text

text.name: gui_ad_routeDeleteWarn_text
text.text: Weet u zeker dat u de route wilt verwijderen '%s'?

text.name: ad_helpText_01_01
text.text: AutoDrive is a multipurpose tool to let your tractors navigate autonomously through the world of Farming Simulator.

text.name: ad_helpText_01_02
text.text: The backbone is an interconnected network of recorded points and defined destinations. For some maps, an initial network is provided with the mod. On most maps you will have to record everything yourself or import a network from another user (see import/export below).

text.name: ad_helpText_01_03
text.text: Provided all destinatons are properly connected to the network, AutoDrive navigates much like your typical navigation system in your car, by calculating the shortest route to the destination.So it is important to ensure that all points are connected to the network. If AutoDrive detects a disconnected point, it is marked with an âXâ and should be removed or connected by the player.

text.name: ad_helpText_02_01
text.text: In this mode, the current vehicle will take the most suited point (by it's current direction and distance) or simply the nearest one and then use the shortest path from there to the destination and stop there. It is the most simple mode and best suited to test your new routes.

text.name: ad_helpText_03_01
text.text: In this mode AutoDrive will drive the vehicle just like in the âOnly Driveâ mode but it will additionally unload the current trailer at the destination, if an unload trigger is detected.

text.name: ad_helpText_03_02
text.text: The destination point should be created behind the unload trigger, so that vehicles with long trailers will reach the unload trigger before reaching the destination.

text.name: ad_helpText_03_03
text.text: The driver will stop at the destination regardless of it beeing empty or not. If you notice that your destination point isnât far enough back, you can easily remove the destination and create it at the following point without having to remove the point it self.(see HUD-Buttons).

text.name: ad_helpText_04_01
text.text: In this mode, you can select to target destinations. One for loading (the first one) and the second one for the unload point.

text.name: ad_helpText_04_02
text.text: If AutoDrive is activated, it will look at the current fill level of the connected trailers/implements. If this value is higher than the set âUnload atâ level (see settings), the driver will directly head for the unload destination.

text.name: ad_helpText_04_03
text.text: Otherwise it will head for the load destination first. Depending on the selected setting (âOn emtpy siloâ), the driver will either wait at the load destination to be filled past the âUnload atâ level or it will continue to the unload destination.

text.name: ad_helpText_04_04
text.text: Either way, the driver will first try to load the selected fill type on any available trigger in the provided range (see settings) before the load destination.

text.name: ad_helpText_04_05
text.text: Additionally you can select a repetition counter before starting the driver. If you set this counter to 2, the driver will stop after having reached the unload destination 2 times. If this setting (see HUD) is left at default, the driver will always start the next cycle.

text.name: ad_helpText_05_01
text.text: This mode is very similar to the previously described âPickup and Deliverâ mode with only a few minor exceptions. It will not respect the ârepetition counterâ.

text.name: ad_helpText_05_02
text.text: There is only a load destination and a target destination at which the driver will stop and disable AutoDrive.

text.name: ad_helpText_05_03
text.text: This mode is intended to be used as refill mode for field work. This way seeders or sprayers can be started at the field location and sent to a refill point and will return to the set field destination afterwards.

text.name: ad_helpText_05_04
text.text: This mode can also be used in conjunction with Courseplay. You will have to select âUse AutoDrive for refll/unloadâ in the Courseplay HUD (not part of this documentation).

text.name: ad_helpText_06_01
text.text: In this mode, you can again set two destinations. The first one should be a field location from where an active harvester can be reached. The second one is again an unload destination.

text.name: ad_helpText_06_02
text.text: This is the first mode in which AutoDrive drivers are allowed to leave the recorded path and drive on the field. This mode is quite complicated and involves many settings from the settings menu.

text.name: ad_helpText_06_03
text.text: So this documentation will first describe the basic behaviour and then add how the settings affect the behaviour.

text.name: ad_helpText_07_01
text.text: The driver will decide on startup whether to head to the field or unload first (see âPickup and Deliver). If it reaches the field location it registers itself as available driver. If a combine harvester is at 100% fill level and has an extended pipe, it will automatically go through the registered unloaders and choose the one that is nearest to him. Depending on the setting âFind unloaderâ either all drivers in a range of 300 meters are accepted (yes) or only drivers with the same target destinations as the harvester in the AutoDrive Hud (no).

text.name: ad_helpText_07_03
text.text: Important: You do not have to activate AutoDrive on the harvester. Only the selected target is required.

text.name: ad_helpText_07_05
text.text: Alternatively, the player can also call the unloader manually by assigning the keybinding âCall Unloaderâ in the game options and using this while sitting in the harvester. If the harvester is controlled by Courseplay, AutoDrive will also call an unloader if it detects that the Courseplay driver wants to be unloaded.

text.name: ad_helpText_08_01
text.text: If an unloader is called to a harvester, it will start planning a path to the extended pipe of the harvester. The path planner is a completely unique implementation and an explanation might be included as appendix to this documentation later on. The core concepts are a division of the simulated world into grid cells. These grid cells are sized according the vehicles turn radius and are checked to be fruit free (see settings), collision free, are on the field (see settings) and have a maximum slope acceptable to AI drivers. After a free path has been found, some smoothing to get rid of most sharp turns is also applied and then the driver is sent along this path to the harvester.

text.name: ad_helpText_08_03
text.text: Note: As soon as the unload driver receives the command to drive to the harvester, the status message in the info bar of the HUD changes from âWaiting for combineâ to âDrive to combineâ. Which means the path planner is now actively searching for a path. Depending on you CPU performance and your settings (âPathfinder time (max)â), this process may take some time and in extreme cases bring your fps down. This is usually the case if the unloader is unable to find an acceptable path to the combine. Always make sure that the space in front of the driver is obstacle free (and fruit free) and the path leading to the pipe of the harvester is also collision free (e.g. no trees fruit just behind the harvester).

text.name: ad_helpText_08_05
text.text: When it reaches the harvester it will check whether the unloading process is finished or if the current trailer is filled. In case of multiple trailers, the driver will drive forwards until a filling process on the next trailer is detected. After the unloading process, the driver will start driving backwards for a few meters to provide the harvester enough space to continue itâs work. Then the driver will wait a few seconds for the harvester to clear the area and start path planning back to the starting point. Upon reaching the starting point it will again register itself as available unloader and wait to be called again. If the trailer is already full at that point it will directly head for the unload destination before returning back to the field location.

text.name: ad_helpTitle_09
text.text: AD modes - Combine Unloader - Park in field

text.name: ad_helpText_09_01
text.text: If this option is set to true in the AutoDrive settings, the driver will check whether the target cell (pipe position) has detected fruit (Fruit Avoidance has to be set to true). If no fruit is detected and the driver has not yet reached itâs âunload atâ fill level, he will remain at the current field location.

text.name: ad_helpTitle_10
text.text: AD modes - Combine Unloader - Restrict to field

text.name: ad_helpText_10_01
text.text: If this option is set to true, the path finder algorithm will only accept grid cells which are on the field. This setting only takes effect if the vehicle is already on the field (started on the field or parked in the field). This option should help to keep the driver on the field, especially during turn manoeuvres.

text.name: ad_helpText_10_03
text.text: Important: If no fruit free path can be calculated in the provided time (see settings), the path finder will go into a fallback mode which ignores fruit and field borders!

text.name: ad_helpTitle_11
text.text: AD modes - Combine Unloader - Fruit avoidance

text.name: ad_helpText_11_01
text.text: This options ensures that the path finder will only accept grid cells that donât contain any fruit or only have a marginal amount of fruit. Important: If no fruit free path can be calculated in the provided time (see settings), the path finder will go into a fallback mode which ignores fruit and field borders!

text.name: ad_helpTitle_12
text.text: AD modes - Combine Unloader - Chase combine

text.name: ad_helpText_12_03
text.text: These options can be used to either simply follow the harvester with some distance (Pre call driver on / chase combine off). Or to have the unloader actively unload while the harvester is still driving. When the harvester reaches the set fill level (Pre call level), it will already call the driver to itâs current location. Once the driver reaches this point it will re-evaluate. If he is close to the harvester (less than 60 meters) and the âchase combineâ setting is on, he will start following him by line of sight. Otherwise he will retrigger a path finding process to the new harvester location. While chasing, he will sense if the pipe is currently in the fruit or not. If it isn't in the fruit, he will start targeting the pipe location, otherwise he will follow the harvester with some distance. When the driver reaches itâs âUnload atâ level he will immediately start planning a path to the selected field exit (see settings). Thus it makes sense to set the level to 100% in this mode. This way he wonât accidentally try to cut in front of the harvester or leave before being completely filled.

text.name: ad_helpText_13_01
text.text: This mode can only be used with vehicles that have a shovel attached. The basic idea is a one-click solution to empty drive-through bunker silos. On startup, the vehicle will check for the required conditions. It needs a filled bunker silo in the vicinity (~100m?) and an attached shovel. If both conditions are met, the vehicle will initialize itâs front loader axis to aquire the correct values for up/down, load/unload and extend/retract motions. Then he will divide the bunker silo width into chunks as wide as his shovel + shovel addition (see settings) and start at the first line. If the first or the last line ends up hitting the silo wall, you should increase the shovel addition value in the settings and restart the driver. This can occur if either the shovel pickup width is not matched properly to the physical dimensions or the bunker silo definition lies inside the wall, which is not unusual since it makes it easier to develop a good looking bunker silo. After the shovel is flled and the vehicle reversed from the bunker, it will scan for a vehicle with an attached trailer (with left fill space) and start heading there.

text.name: ad_helpText_13_03
text.text: Caution: There is currently no collision detection included in this mode!

text.name: ad_helpText_13_05
text.text: Since the vehicle tries to find the ideal loading position for the shovel automatically, it can happen that he lifts itâs front wheels up. There is a detection included for this scenario, which checks if all wheels are on the ground and starts lifting the shovel if this check returns false for a few hundred milliseconds.

text.name: AD_task_wait_for_combine_turn
text.text: Wacht op de beurt van de maaidorser
